Boston.com
10

US jobless rate up to 7.9%; 171K jobs added in Oct.

Hiring was stronger in the previous two months than first thought as unemployment hit 7.9 percent from 7.8 percent in September because the work force grew.
 (AP, 9:25 a.m.)
  • US futures mixed ahead of October jobs report

Romney, Obama each gain in jobs report

As an economic marker, the report shows a job market that is gradually gaining momentum, but politically, it gives Mitt Romney a data point to attack. (AP, 9:11 a.m.)
  • Romney: A 'sad reminder' that economy is at standstill
  • NYC mayor Bloomberg endorses Obama

With Hurricane Sandy bringing attention to climate change, researchers say the city and its shoreline may be defenseless to more frequent, intense storms. (Globe)
